segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle at her feet is growing, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the water, but she just keeps polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s totally oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip and fall before she realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is streaming down the cabinets, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be ruined by the time she notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so chaotic, yet she’s calm as can be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away—I need to see if she finally reacts.
segments.speaker: PAR
